name: List
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Log
List
description: Log::List is a special case Array with additional values.

methods.name: token
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Log
List#token
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: token=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Log
List#token=
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: next?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Log
List#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of logs.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new

logs = logging.logs
if logs.next?
  next_logs = logs.next
end

require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new

logs = logging.logs
if logs.next?
  next_logs = logs.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Log
List#all
methods.description:
Retrieves all log names by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each log name, which is passed as the parameter.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all log names are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each log name by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new
logs = logging.logs

logs.all { |l| puts l }

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new
logs = logging.logs

logs.all(request_limit: 10) { |l| puts l }

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to
make to load all log names. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each log name.
